Case reference: 2019051624.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2019, Michael Samdas was last seen on Yonge Street in Toronto, Ontario. Michael has connections in several cities in Ontario, such as Hamilton, Sudbury, North Bay, Brantford, Toronto and Niagara.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Other, Dark, medium length hair with highlights on tips

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018043211.CaseDesc: On December 18, 1995, at approximately 8:00am, Sukhia Budhram was seen for the last time when she moved out of her son’s apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Since then, Sukhia has not had any contact with her family.

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: Amber Potts was last seen in her hometown of Etobicoke, Ontario when she was 16 years old. She has a history of running away, however she always kept in touch with family or friends. She had been staying in a hotel, but she left behind all her personal belongings and hasn't been seen since. Amber had substance abuse issues.

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Hair: Brown, Red, Straight, Hair is shaved around sides and back with medium length section on the top
Pierce: Ears, 3 piercings on the right side and 1 on the left

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2021006190.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014003009.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1979, Adolphe Thorassie and three hunting partners were attempting to return home after a successful hunt. Two men were in each boat. On the return trip the men had to go to shore once to get out of the winds. They again departed despite the high winds on the lake which was causing the water to be extremely dangerous with high waves. Adolphe was in the lead boat with his hunting partner, and unbeknownst to him the second boat had to return to shore for motor repairs. Adolphe and his hunting partner never returned and were reported missing the next day. The body of Adolphe's hunting partner was discovered and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. It is assumed Mr. Thorassie also drowned.

Case reference: 2012020121.CaseDesc: Mathieu Beauregard Messier was alone at home with his wife. At approximately 7:00 p.m., Mathieu told his wife he had to go see a friend and that he would be back later in the evening. He left alone in his wife’s vehicle and with her cellphone. At approximately 10:30 p.m., police received a call that a vehicle was on fire on Rang du Haut-de-la-Rivière, near the military base in Farnham, Quebec. The vehicle was identified as that of Mathieu’s wife. There was nobody inside the vehicle, and Mathieu has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004516.CaseDesc: On March 19 2004, Daniel James Murray was reported missing to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel slipped on ice and fell into the North Saskatchewan River in the area of Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2012020034.CaseDesc: The Edmonton Police Service is seeking assistance in locating Dylan Steven Koshman. He was last seen on October 12, 2008 on the south side of Edmonton.

Case reference: 2018046253.CaseDesc: On January 31, 1997, at approximately 4:30pm, Daphne Powell was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Daphne left her residence with two suitcases, some money and indicated that she was going to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2019073733.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, Trevor Batoche was seen for the last time in Penticton, British Columbia. Trevor was known to frequently travel to Northern British Columbia and Edmonton, Alberta, possibly driving an older black pickup truck.

Case reference: 2016064577.CaseDesc: On December 9, 1982, the remains of an adult male were discovered outside of a burning shed at 348 Front Street West, with burns to the body. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 139lbs and his length was measured between 5'4" and 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  His appendix was present. It is likely that he was an alcoholic.

Deformity: Torso (Back), Spine was curved to the side and the front; this may have been noticeable

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2005004299.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were recovered from the Niagara River bay area at the rear of the Sir Adam Beck Power Station, near the turbine intakes. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014007308.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1970, the body of a two to four week old male baby was found on the ice under the bridge on Highway 4, south of Kyle, SK. Investigation failed to identify the infant or suspects. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2012020094.CaseDesc: Gordon Harvey was last seen on July 24, 2008, at approximately 2130 hours. He was swimming in the Saskatchewan River near Cranberry Flats, south of Saskatoon, SK. Personal clothing and articles of identification belonging to Mr. Harvey were recovered on the shore near where he was last seen swimming.

Case reference: 2014006180.CaseDesc: Tammy Penner has not been in contact with friends or family since 2005. Tammy did not live in one place for any significant period of time, and has traveled across Canada. Prior to her disappearance, she had been living in Chilliwack and Abbotsford in British Columbia. Tammy suffered from a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2014002160.CaseDesc: Jackelene Bylow was last seen at her residence on November 13, 1994 after having dinner at a restaurant near Willington Ave and Hastings St. She suffers from mental illness and addicted to drugs and alcohol.

Tattoo: Chest, Duck and blue bird on right breast

Case reference: 2014006547.CaseDesc: Gregory Caesar was last seen near Watson Lake, Yukon Territory, in October, 2009. He was hitchhiking along the Alaska Highway and was believed to be heading to the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2012020162.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River near New Westminster.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, distinctive under bite, missing a number of teeth which would have resulted in a unique smile
Jewelry: Silver, Brown, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Swiss made watch, 4 diamond inserts, serial number 8564524
Shoes: Other, "Transit" brand burgundy shoes with brown laces
Shirt: Cotton, Beige, T-shirt "Fruit of the Loom" brand
Cotton, Grey, "Tip Top" brand golf shirt
Jacket: Cotton, Beige, "Colorado" brand fleece with grey stripes on the sleeves

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2017031348.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2017, Mary Papatsie was reported missing. Ms. Papatsie was last seen in the afternoon of April 27, 2017, in the area of Montreal Road and Marier Street in Ottawa. Ms. Papatsie lived a high risk lifestyle. There has been no contact with family or friends since. Numerous sightings were reported to the police in the weeks following Ms. Papatsie’s disappearance, however, no one spoke directly to her. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed.

Scar: Left Eye, Due to a piercing

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2012020096.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2008, Kevin Michel was with two other people at Usinne Lake, near Creighton, Saskatchewan, harvesting rice. Witnesses state Kevin walked away from their camp for reasons unknown. Extensive ground, air and water searches were conducted in the area but failed to locate Kevin.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Kevin heart bombers" (text) or "Kevin (heart symbol) bombers"

Case reference: 2019035278.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1982, the remains of a male were found on the banks of Bouchard Island, near Saint-Sulpice, Quebec.

Coat: Leather, Black, Three-quarters with fur collar

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2018062782.CaseDesc: On April 12, 1993, at approximately 4:30pm, Helen Bialowas was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2014004048.CaseDesc: Dwayne Allen Rideout was last seen on September 24, 1999 at the Generator Cabaret on 3rd Avenue in Prince George, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2006017299.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1998, Jake Just attended a party at a residence in the north end of the town of Midland. He was last seen walking home from the party, then separating from his friends to take a short cut through a wooded area. An extensive search of the area turned up negative.

Shoes: Canvas, Black, Blue, "DVS" - skateboarder style - size 11
Backpack: Nylon, Black, Gold, jaguar logo and gold stitching
Scar: Left Upper Arm, 4" raised scar inside bicep

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13th 2019 Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2017040791.CaseDesc: On the night of July 16, 2017, Thomas Burke was seen for the last time leaving his home in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Thomas had left after a family meeting over financial issues. It did not appear that he took anything with him.

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2006019499.CaseDesc: David Block was reported missing from Swastika, Ontario. He had been seen in Newfoundland in 1994.  Mr. Block suffered from mental health issues that could bring him to the attention of authorities. He was last seen in Washington D.C., U.S.A, on May 1, 1995.

Case reference: 2014006374.CaseDesc: Rosalie Jean ALLAN was last seen at the end of November, start of December 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2006001699.CaseDesc:
On July 27, 1992, the body of a male, believed to be Caucasian, was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His upper right central incisor had a root canal treatment and there was a metallic restoration at its root end. There were several other sites of root canal treatment.
His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Teeth: Many post. teeth & U-left lat. incisor:missing before death. Many fillings amalgam & composite. U-right cent. incisor: grey
Shoes: Blue and white "L.A. Gear" running shoes
Shirt: Black, T-shirt, "True North Sweats Designer " brand

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2005006999.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1981, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 40 to 60 years, was recovered from the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. He was seen jumping from a Ferry Boat by witnesses on board. He was transferred to Toronto General Hospital where he died on August 7, 1981. Staining on his teeth suggests that he was a smoker.

Teeth: Visible Missing, All of his upper teeth are absent and he only has five anterior teeth in his lower jaw.
Shirt: Yellow, A dark yellow shirt with blue and red box stripes
Deformity: Left Leg, Left leg is shorter than his right leg and it is possible that he may have had to wear lifts
Nose, Appears to have been previously broken.
Scar: Left Leg, Scarring on his left outer thigh and lower leg, probable skin donor sites.
Pelvis, Scars on both inguinal (groin) areas, possibly from hernia repairs.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2005003399.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2004, an unidentified man was recovered from the Whirlpool in the Lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs. and his length was measured at 6'0", however these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. This male is uncircumcised, and his appendix is present. It is believed that this individual had been in the water for less than 3 weeks but it is also possible that the body could have been in the water over the winter.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Few strands a couple of inches long
Teeth: Natural teeth with extensive dental restorations

Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2006, Freda Whiteman was seen for the last time at the York Hotel in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2013000085.CaseDesc: On April 17, 1994, Jose Fernandez was seen for the last time at his residence in the Villeray district in Montreal, Quebec. Following a disagreement, Jose left home in his car without saying where he was going. The vehicle was a red, 4-door Mercury Capri.

Case reference: 2014003015.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1984 Donald Williamson's brother reported him as missing since September 6th. He has a history of disappearing without maintaining contact with his family. There is no foul play suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014004404.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1993, Sidiki Camara was reported missing by air traffic control after disappearing from the radar while flying to Prince Edward Island from the Moncton Airport. Sidiki's plane was last recorded descending at a high rate of speed. Only a few parts of the plane were found during a search of the crash location.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2015039943.CaseDesc: A family member reported that they had not seen Clarence Bigeye since 1974.

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2014006270.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Daniel Pierre was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was driving a rented 2014 black Jeep Grand Cherokee, and was accompanied by his reddish brown, with a white chest, male pit-bull. The vehicle was subsequently located on the corner of Deguire Boulevard and Ashton Street in the Ville Saint-Laurent neighbourhood in Montreal. Daniel is a diabetic and depends on medication that is not in his possession.

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2012020102.CaseDesc: Male human remains were found on May 5th 2003 in Sainte-Melanie of the Lanaudiere region. Surete du Quebec made a call out to an RCMP specialist who did a facial reconstruction based on the cranium found. The remains would be those of a black male, early 30's, medium build, between 1,57m and 1,72m who was shot several times in the head.

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date Mr. MacDonald has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020010632.CaseDesc: April Parisian was last seen at Yale, British Columbia, on or about March 28, 2021. April has not been seen or heard since.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2014005202.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2008, Ani Ashekian phoned her family residing in Canada while visiting Hong Kong, China. Ani a world traveler has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2019040192.CaseDesc: The skull belonging to an adult male was found on a beach near Ucluelet, British Columbia in October 1980. The man had a strong jawline and had a visible gap in his teeth on the upper left side. It is believed he was deceased several years prior to skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014001584.CaseDesc: Alexander Petritsis was last seen June 30, 1994, in Montreal. He left his residence with his car, without saying where he was going to anyone. On that day, Alexander did not go to work.

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Mrs. Medzech had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2014004827.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2004, 41 year old Jacqueline "Jackie" Bob was last seen picking mushrooms in the Brittany Triangle of the Nemiah Valley.

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2014001063.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1980, the remains of an adult male were found in the Fraser River near Mission, British Columbia. He had no teeth and probably wore dentures. He had two healed vertical scars on the abdomen below the navel and estimated to have died several months prior to discovery.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical scar from Umbilicus to sternum
Abdomen, Surgical scar in rectus area
